alert.note: Alert for Clay; Letcher; Perry (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 26 at 4:19PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Harlan, southern Leslie, southwestern Letcher, southeastern Perry and southeastern Clay Counties through 445 PM EDT... At 417 PM EDT, weather radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Viper to Big Fork to Chappell to Bluehole. Movement was southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Chappell, Big Rock, Mozelle, Big Fork, Leatherwood, Yeaddiss, Causey, Warbranch and Spruce Pine around 425 PM EDT. Big Laurel, Slemp, Daisy, Arthur, Cornettsville and Ulvah around 430 PM EDT. Napier and Bledsoe around 435 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Pine Mountain, Delphia, Banks, Hallie, Gilley, Totz, Nolansburg, Putney, Highsplint, Diane, Skyline, Lilley Cornett Woods, Skidmore, Queendale and Gardner. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
